Hi everyone.

Can anyone give me a couple of tips to keep my Windows 10 PC running smoothly? It's running great now I just want to keep it that way for as long as possible... Here's what I've done so far:

  • Uninstalled unused programs;
  • Made sure to disable unwanted startup applications (like 'Adobe Acrobat SpeedLauncher' or 'CCleaner');
  • Cleared disk space with windows tool and then with CCleaner on both drives (HDD and SSD);
  • Analyzed and cleaned windows and applications;
  • Cleaned the registry with CCleaner;
  • Ran checkdisk and defrag on the HDD (not the SSD);

I only use Windows Defender as my AV software because, from what I've seen, it's both light weight and competent.

Aside from what I've done so far does anyone have any other tip they want to share?

Edited August 30, 2015 by sal_vager

Just be wary. Some people are very clever, and can get you even after you've done everything in your power to stop it.

Keep up to date on essentials, too.

Format the drive and install Windows 7. Best maintenance.

To be honest I skipped windows 8/8.1 for the reasons everyone knows but I'm enjoying my experience with windows 10. As far as an OS goes it's at least as stable as windows 7 and I dare say a bit faster. What really gets me worried are all the smallprints on the EULA that make me consider switching to a local account and changing a bunch of privacy settings.

That being said I think I'd move to Linux faster then I'd move to Win7. And that ain't happening anytime soon. I've used Ubuntu on my old computer for almost a year and although Linux has come a looooong way it still has a long way to go before I can consider it a worthy desktop alternative for a median user like myself.
